column4: Hello. I am using a fresh install of 12.04, trying to log into my ubuntu one, being asked for the keyring password. My user login password does not satisfy it. What can it be? Is there any default keyring password?
could you submit a screenshot of the window?
sure. to which website?
tinypic is fine with me
when being asked for the keyring password, I cannot do anything else - neither writing here, nor taking a screenshot. But I can copy it to my notebook and write it here...
this is the view a moment before the request for keyring password: http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=9to8sp&s=6
look at "The user cancelled a prompt". this what happens after I cancel after a few unsuccesful password enter tries.
it wants your ubuntu one password not your localhost password. Try the "I forgot my password" button.
I know that. I know my ubuntu one password as well. What I was saying is that after I click "sign in" it asks for my keyring password, and does not accept my regular ubuntu login password.
its trying to store the password or recall it from the keyring. What version of ubuntu?
sys up to date?
I've been updated about 35 minutes ago.
and you rebooted correct?
yes. It is a fresh install, I have rebooted once since the problem occured.
have you set a root password?
I have not installed it, a computer guy has done that. He says he has not set any password but my login password, but I suspect he might be wrong. He's not here to help any more.
sudo passwd root
thanks, I have updated it. I'll try again with the keyring - or should I reboot first?
ok, I do have a root password now, but it is not the keyring password.
I'd do that as well, if I'd known how
